Bootstrap

Source: freecodecamp

Introduction

Bootstrap is a front-end framework used to design reponsive web pages and web applications. It takes a mobile-first approach to web development.

Bootstrap includes pre-built CSS styles and classes, plus some JavaScript functionality, and uses a reponsive 12 column grid layout.

It has design templates for:

  • buttons,
  • images,
  • tables,
  • forms,
  • navigation.

Use responsive design with Bootstrap Fluid Containers

Bootstrap figures out how wide the currentr scren is and resize HTML elements accordingly.

Adding bootstrap to a website

Place this into the HTML-file:

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/css/bootstrap.min.css" integrity="sha384-BVYiiSIFeK1dGmJRAkycuHAHRg32OmUcww7on3RYdg4Va+PmSTsz/K68vbdEjh4u" crossorigin="anonymous"/>

container-fluid

To use Bootstrap, place all HTML page content in a `

.

Make images mobile responsive

In Bootstrap, all you need to do to make images responsive to the width of the mobile screen, is to add a class named img-responsive to the particular image.

Example:

  <img class="img-responsive"; src="https://bit.ly/fcc-running-cats" alt="cats running">

Center text with Bootstrap

Centering text is done by adding the class text-center to a text element.

Example:

h2 class="red-text text-center">Your text</h2>

Create a Bootstrap button

Bootstrap has its own styles for button elements.

Add the classes btn and btn-default to use the Bootstrap styles.

Create a block element Bootstrap button

Besides adding btn and btn-default to a button element, add btn-block to make the width fit the maximum available space.

<button class="btn btn-default btn-block">Submit</button>

Change bootstrap button colors

The btn-primary class is the main color of the app, useful to highlight most important actions.

It can be used in place of btn-default.

Call out optional actions with btn-info

Bootstrap comes with several pre-defined colors for buttons. The btn-info class is used to call attention to optional actions the user can take.

Example:

  <button class="btn btn-block btn-info">Info</button>

Warn the user of a dangerous action with btn-danger

The btn-danger class is the button color you'll use to notify that the button performs a destructuve actions, such as deleting an item.

Example:

<button class="btn btn-block btn-danger">Delete</button>

Use the Bootstrap grid to put elements side by side

Bootstrap uses a 12-column grid system, making it easy to put elements into rows and specify each element's relative width.

Most of Bootstrap's classes can be applied to a grid element.

Bootstrap has different column width attributes that it uses depending on how wide the user's screen is.

For example, take Bootstrap's col-md-* class. Here md means medium, and * is a number specifying how many columns wide the element should be.

In this case, the column width of an element on a medium-sized screen, such as a laptop is being specified.

The row class is applied to a div, and the buttons themselves can be nested within it.

Example:

<div class="row">
  <div class="col-xs-4">
  <button class="btn btn-block btn-primary">Like</button>
  </div>
  <div class="col-xs-4">
  <button class="btn btn-block btn-info">Info</button>
  </div>
  <div class="col-xs-4">
  <button class="btn btn-block btn-danger">Delete</button>
  </div>
</div>

Use a span to target inline elements

You can use spans to create inline elements.

By using the inline span element, you can put several elements on the same line, and even style different parts of the same line differently.

Example:

<p>Things cats <span class="text-danger">love</span>:</p>

Add Font Awesome icons to buttons

Font Awesome is a convenient library for icons.

Include the Font Awesome library by adding:

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://use.fontawesome.com/releases/v5.8.1/css/all.css" integrity="sha384-50oBUHEmvpQ+1lW4y57PTFmhCaXp0ML5d60M1M7uH2+nqUivzIebhndOJK28anvf" crossorigin="anonymous">

The i element was originally used to make elements italic, but is now commonly used for icons. Using the for example:

<i class="fas fa-info-circle"></i>

Note - the span element is also acceptable for use with icons.
